text: Hi all.. Iam a bit new to HubSpot. I have built a theme, I can see it in the design tools and can also test it out, however when I try to build a webpage with that theme, I cannot see it anywhere (nor search for it). did I forget to add something somewhere? I bet this question gets asked a lot here...
Which HubSpot plan should we purchase for making custom email templates?
Emails are part of the Marketing Hub. I would assume any level of a paid marketing plan should get you that template access.

Is somebody seriously developing  in PRODUCTION against client sites on HubSpot????

I'm sitting here working on something, and suddenly there is a new JS console error which can only be due to due to a dev at HubSpot plugging in a bad regex.

The endpoint for "Get recently added contacts from a list" isn't working properly for some time now.
The pagination via vidOffset has no effect on the queried response. A similar issue with list pagination was in July as well.

Developing in productions is the way to go. Also that package might not be a HubSpot package, a quick google search shows tons of similar packages. I can't seem to get that same error which means I can't see where the package is coming from.
its on our knowledgebase where we have so little control over templates that 100% of the code is HubSpot.
Yes, but HubSpot _might_ be including a module developed by someone else
Do you have the url for that page?
For example this module looks like the exact same thing: <https://github.com/kaimallea/isMobile/blob/master/src/isMobile.ts>

Brand new here. I need to know where to post a question. I have an OAuth configuration and working/tested code for accessing a the basic company/contacts API.  I now need to have this OAuth configuration out to the first customer. Basically,  the first step in getting a blessed APP. How do I go about doing this?  I don't seem to find this searching through the online documents.
